de.gbv.beacon
Interface BeaconHandler

public interface BeaconHandler

Process metadata and links from a Beacon link dump.

This is the main interface that applications must implement to process a Beacon dump from a BeaconParser. The parser uses the method of this interface as callback in the following order:

  • first beaconMeta(java.util.HashMap) is called once,
  • then beaconLink(de.gbv.beacon.BeaconLink) is called zero or more times,
  • then beaconEnd() is called once.
This process may be repeated when parsing multiple Beacon dumps.

All meta fields and links send to the callback methods should be validated and expanded. To directly access serialized Beacon dumps, one may alternatively use the interface BeaconProcessor.

Author:
Jakob Voss
See Also:
BeaconProcessor

Method Summary
 void beaconEnd()
          Called once after the last link in a Beacon dump.
 void beaconLink(BeaconLink link)
          Called for each link in the Beacon dump.
 void beaconMeta(HashMap<String,String> metadata)
          Called once to process all annotating meta fields.
 

Method Detail

beaconMeta

void beaconMeta(HashMap<String,String> metadata)
Called once to process all annotating meta fields.

beaconLink

void beaconLink(BeaconLink link)
Called for each link in the Beacon dump. The relation type is guaranteed to be equal for all links until the next call of beaconLink(de.gbv.beacon.BeaconLink).

beaconEnd

void beaconEnd()
Called once after the last link in a Beacon dump.
